phrase.item: My name is Rahila.
When I was six years old, [we] moved to New York from Gilgit [Pakistan]. My parents are from Hunza, Pakistan.
My parents have spoken to me in Wakhi since I was growing up.
With my siblings when we moved here, I spoke to my sisters and brothers in English.
But with my parents I speak in Wakhi.
It has been challenging sometimes -- my Wakhi is not really good.
Sometimes there are things that I cannot say [to express myself]
So it is hard to communicate.
However, I try to listen to listen to Wakhi songs, and watch programs in Wakhi on the internet, and I learn and understand.
And it is good to not let it go extinct.

Sometimes it is hard to learn Wakhi and to understand it, because when you try to learn the language there are only a few resources and books, you know. With other languages, when you are willing to learn
you go to the library or store, get the book and learn the language. Also you can search on the internet and right away

you can find everything. Since my childhood, whenever I found something, I used to read it for the purpose of learning Wakhi. There is not enough information about the Wakhi language and it has been challenging.
It is difficult to learn it and read it.
In order to keep our language alive, there are many things that can be done.
Whether you are in your own country or a different one, you should always speak Wakhi to your children, because so that in whatever country you stay in, the [children] would learn the language.
But [the child] won't be able to learn Wakhi outside [the home].
At home, they need to be talked to in Wakhi.
If you are willing to read, and have an interest in reading about Wakhis, you need to learn about Wakhis, and to seek knowledge, through education and by doing research, Wakhi learning.
There are also organizations and grants can be found in order to learn and work on the language.
Also, arts are a major thing that you can do to preserve your language. There are great Wakhi poets, there are good photographers, [A photographer] might not be able to preserve the language,
but we have good videographers and by making videos they can do it.
So there are different ways you can preserve the language
So like that.
I believe it is essential to keep the Wakhi language alive. Because any Wakhi- when a Wakhi person lives in any country, he could speak both Wakhi and the language spoken in that country.
We Wakhis have two identities: we are Wakhi and we are of whatever country we are staying in.
If you don't speak Wakhi and don't know it, you will get used to the other culture.
It's not something bad that whenever you live somewhere, you get into it, but it is also good not to forget [your language], your history, and what is your people's language,
and whatever person has done in his or her life.
So everything is in the language. Your history, what your grandfathers have done, for that language is important. You should not forget your language, so that you will not forget your history.
